reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because all of the ones available through my convention were booked. I was a little uneasy because it's an independent property, and when I think "boutique hotel" I think cramped and overly frilly.
reviews.title: This hotel does everything right.

likes.disliked: — I didn't care for the breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I shouldn't have worried. This hotel is excellent. They set the tone at check-in. I arrived late at night, but found the night staff every bit as sharp as the day crew. Check-in was efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Everything others siad it was

likes.disliked: — only one lap-top PC in public area, I do beleive however they have internet access in rooms. No public sitting room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Even though the room was two doubles (I prefer a king or queen), it was large and comfortable. The linens are soft, the furniture in good condition, the bathroom was large and spotlessly clean, and the DVD system was a nice plus. (they lend DVD's at the front desk for free) You'll also find a CD in the room called "Deep Sleep 101" that helped me unwind and put me to sleep within minutes.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with excellent service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually don't sleep well the first night in a hotel because I'm not comfortable. I slept soundly the first night at the Orchard - it's that comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of all the hotels I've been in this year on business (and at last count, I'm over 100 nights on the road this year) this is the first one I want to come back with my wife and vacation at.
reviews.title: Clean establishment, good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay at the Orchard. Based on tripadvisor
reviews.title: What a gem!

likes.liked: — Nice touches like down comforters, complimentary breakfast, free high speed internet.
likes.disliked: — No wireless internet in the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: reviews, we booked a 6-night stay at the Orchard at the end of March.
reviews.title: Orchard is Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very reasonable rate ($135/night) from the hotel website using our good old-fashioned AAA discount. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Spot for my first San Fran Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic. It's set a couple of blocks north of Union Square, giving you easy and quick access to Union Square, the Financial District, Chinatown, and the Embarcadero. Even though the hotel is in the middle of everything, it's located on a relatively calm, quiet street. It definitely feels like going "home" to walk up the short hill away from Union Square to the hotel. There's also a small grocery store on the same block where you can pick up snacks and anything you forgot from home.
reviews.title: Wonderful --
Great value and location
reviews.text: Inside, the hotel is very nicely appointed. Check-in at the marble-tiled lobby was smooth and quick. The rooms are clean, bright, and fresh. The beds are very big and comfortable, with soft white sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at the Orchard. Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Clean modern well decorated rooms.
reviews.title: 3rd visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely perfect for us. The location was great (we wanted to be near all the touristy stuff, but out of the Tenderloin), the staff were helpful and warm, and the bed, oh the bed was so incredibly huge and comfy! The room (street side, 8th floor) was surprisingly quiet. Occasionally we could hear a tiny clang clang of the cable car, and that's it! No neighbour noise either.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel - Perfect for us

likes.disliked: — I asked them to take away feather pillows, but they just put them in the closet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wonderful brochure listing all sorts of green places, and the products were all organic and nice (even if the shampoo didn't do the greatest job, it smelled great). The fridge was packed, though we didn't use anything there (we used it for storing our own water and drinks). I really can't say enough about this hotel - we will stay there again for sure!!
reviews.title: Loved it.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel. Arrived at the start of October. The hotel is in a perfect location. This was the last hotel we stayed in over a four week trip and was almost certainly the best. Cable car is just on the corner and Union Square one block away. The hotel is really clean, very well presented and the rooms are spacious. Staff were very polite and helpful. Would happily book here again if I returned to SF. Not particularly cheap, but we got a good deal via Hotels.com and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are from holland and stayed here for 6 nights. We loved everything about it. The room, the staf and the location. Just a few meters away from the cabel car stop (buy a ticket for three days, and you can use all muni transportation, incl. cable car, for 18USD).
reviews.title: Clean and Quiet Union Square Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for a 7-night stay October 14-21, on the strength of its high rating on this site and the reviews. We were certainly not disappointed! Staff were friendly, right from the initial welcome, and able to advise on things like what bus to catch to the Golden Gate bridge. The requests we made at the time of booking were met.
reviews.title: Worth its place at the top of the ratings

likes.disliked: — Breakfast buffet - so chose a la carte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location - near the intersection of Bush & Powell Streets, convenient for Union Square shops, cable cars, Chinatown, and easy to get to just about everywhere else. A safe area, with enough places to eat nearby.
reviews.title: Prefect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities - a moderately sized hotel, with 10 floors but only about 12 rooms on each floor. Elevators always arrived promptly. Ice machines are on every third floor, but hidden away behind doors so you may need to ask at reception where they are. There is a laptop at reception for customer use, useful for checking emails, checking in for return flights, etc.
reviews.title: great place, super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - the hotel met our request for a high floor and there was no external or internal noise. Also the room did not face onto the street. A good size room with plenty of places to put things. A very comfortable king size bed. Air conditioning was quiet and could be adjusted for the desired temperature. En-suite bathroom with bath/shower - not a big bath but I hate it when a hotel only offers you a shower! The worst thing I can say about the room is that the plug in the washbasin allowed water to slowly trickle out.
reviews.title: Great hotel in excellent location

likes.liked: — Quiet, spacious room with very comfortable bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - choice of a la carte or buffet. The buffet selection was rather limited (only one type of meat, for example) and the price was much the same as for a la carte so we went for the menu choice. I recommend the salmon. Typical cost 15-20 dollars.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, right in the heart of San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here one night in late October. Very nice. Small, intimate hallways that don't run 1/2 mile. Room was large and comfortable. Our room had a 1/2 bay window that was very nice. Really liked the robes in the closet. Wished there was a mini fridge. Located right by Chinatown and a trolley stop goes right next to the hotel to take you down to Fisherman's Warf. Would love to have stayed longer and will return here next time. A very good value for a hotel in the Union Square Chinatown area.
reviews.title: Very Nice. Good Value. Something Extra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I go to SF on business a couple of times a year and always stay near Union Square, which to me is very centrally located. I had some good and bad experiences with hotels in the area, as the neighborhoods can change from good to bad quickly. This is a very good, reasonably priced (for SF) small hotel near Union Square. The place was clean and my room was of good size and quiet (my room was on the 4th floor and overlooked Bush Street). The bathroom was very big and looked brand new.
reviews.title: Clean, good location, good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Orchard's website claims it is a "Luxury Boutique Hotel". Not sure I would go that far. The "luxury amenities" on the website include conceirge desk and newspaper in lobby. 'Nuff said. I used the fitness center, which was typical for a hotel (1 treadmill, one bike and one elliptical, I think, in a very small room). If you're there for more than 1-2 nights you might want to pay the fee for a day pass to a nearby gym.
reviews.title: Good place to sty near Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is, however, a very good hotel. I walked to and from the BART station at Powell with my wheelie suitcase. And it is nice not to have to stand in a check-in/check-out line 8-10 people deep. The doorman, unlike another recent reviewer's experience, was very attentive and knowledgeable, and the check-in staff was efficient and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good enough for a one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: A very decent place. Close to Union Square, but just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Downtown. Very quiet - although just a few steps way from busy Powell Street, very little street noise could be heard. Large, clean room and nice bathroom.
reviews.title: pretty awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family stayed for a week at the Orchard at the end of August in 2 connecting rooms. The rooms were large (our rooms were at the end of the hall; the room sizes do vary, but all seem to be adaquate), and the bathrooms were very large. The rooms were immaculate; the bedding is a little firm. We used the HVAC a couple of times, and it was whisper quiet. In general the rooms and the hotel are very quiet (our room faced Bush St. Other reviews said rooms facing the alley can be noisy). The views from the street side are OK - - nothing outstanding. Very attractive, relatively new, furniture.
reviews.title: Great Find

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet, large rooms, convenient location, free breakfast and free internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a king bed, while our children each had twin beds - but these twins were very wide, not the standard twin beds you might be familiar with.
reviews.title: Met All Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The linens and bath towels were excellent; the bath robes were great. The turn-down service was a nice, unexpected touch. The TV/DVD/Surround sound system, with free current DVD movies at the desk, provide a nice way to relax after a long day of sight-seeing. The staff, from the front desk to the doormen, were accommodating, professional and pleasant.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast was adaquate - - not great, but very convenient. It was buffet style fresh fruit, breads (surprisingly, no bagels), cereals, yogurt, juices, ham, cheese, coffee and tea. The free internet access is a big plus when you need to stay in touch with the office frequently.
reviews.title: If you like to shop, this is the place for you...
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a wonderfully convenient area, a few blocks north of Union Square, and a few blocks away from China Town. A cable car stops at the corner that can take you to Fishermen's Wharf and Pier 39 (an unexpectedly tacky area - glad we didn't stay there).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am always on the look-out for a clean, comfortable, convenient, friendly, quiet, upscale-contemporary Hotel when I travel, (since I travel alot). Recently in SFO for business, this was a real find. Not only was the bellman helpful and friendly but the desk staff also. The I-Net connection was a breeze (available on any floor), and its free! They give you a password at check-in and cables, if needed. They also have a DVD movie library available. I also loved having a CD player to listen to music in the evening. Since this is a newly constructed Hotel, they installed special double pane windows that muffle the sound and although the cable car bell could be heard during the day, it was very quiet at night. The down comforter and pillows were a treat and the second pillow is not down (in case you are allergic). Our room was spacious and everything said in other reviews is true. It was a nice suprise to have Aveda products in the bath, robes and Frette linens on the bed! If you are in need of a small meeting room, their Boardroom is "state of the art", with no extra charges for wireless. Parking; valet at $38, is normal. You are in the city. Stay up the hill a little ways and it is $50 per night! Continental breakfast was perfect. Even with the tons of wonderful eateries close by, we stopped in one evening for a light dinner and drinks at the restaurant and had the most wonderful foie Gras and seared scallops. We will definately be back!
reviews.title: A Gem in SFO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just had a wonderful stay at the Orchard which I would not have found if it wasn't for trip advisor so thank you to all previous reviewers.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Orchard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I found the staff wonderfully helpful and informative as well as being cheerful, something not seen in all hotels! My room, on the eighth floor was spaceous and very comfortable. I agree that the bed was quite firm and my only complaint was that the pillows are way too soft and provide no support at all. The bathroom was much larger than I am used to and the Aveda products were lovely.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
Very average ... what a letdown !!!
reviews.text: All in all a great place to stay. The muni travel pass is a must if you want to avoid the steep hill from post to bush using the cable car ($24 for 7 days). My advice is to avoid the large queues at the terminus at powell/market and wait at the first or second stop futher on, indicated by brown signs. That way you do not have a long wait and it is usually not a problem to hop on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Would recommend the Orchard and absolutely stay here again on repeat visits.
reviews.title: Well Rested at the Orchard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here in December and would definitely stay here again. The rooms are a good size, comfortable beds, good bathroom and efficient service. Didn't have dinner here but the breakfast was enjoyable. The location is fairly central, a tram stop just up the road as well as a 24 hour diner which we utilised one night.
reviews.title: Good size rooms, and good service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Orchard Hotel is on the top of the first very big hill on Powell street. We couldve taken the trolley up but just decided to hoof it up the hill (my calves are still sore). The room was cute and quaint and CLEAN. Im a freak about clean hotel rooms so this was a plus. Initially are view wasnt that great but they were courteous enough to give us a better room with a view of Powell/Bush street. The staff was nice. The valet was very nice as he let us leave our car for a few extra hours while we grabbed brunch upon checkout. The parking is friggin expensive @ $40/night. as are all the taxes and fees the lovely state of California applies. Overall i spent one night here and i would reccomend. Its close to everything.
reviews.title: I liked it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Orchard and were pleased in every way. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room and bathroom were large and very clean, and the beds and pillows were the perfect degree of softness. What could be better after walking all over SF during the day than to come back to such a quiet and comfortable room?
reviews.title: So Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will certainly stay here again if they promise to put better lighting in the exercise room! This is a great location 2 blocks off union square. It is also 1 block from the Stockton Sutter garage if you want to save on valet parking. The parking is $40 which is lower than most SF hotels in the area. We paid $127 a night through the hotel website. It is an older hotel that has been remodeled using Green materials and methods. They did a great job! Comfy rooms and free internet. The bell staff was very helpful and anticipated all our needs. Breakfast was good, but pricey, at the Daffodil restaurant attached to the lobby. The lighting in the workout room was the only thing needing improvement. This will be my first choice in the future.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have another location on Bust St called the Orchard garden hotel
reviews.title: Location...location...location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a fantastic little hotel in a great location - right at Powell and Bush. Easy walk to virtually everything, right on the cable car line. The rooms are very large, very quiet and well appointed. The bathrooms are huge. There is free wifi, a small workout room and a DVD player in each room with free movies in the lobby. Recommend very highly.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Orchard Hotel based on three things; positive Trip Advisor Reviews, price, and location. Overall it was worth it. We were early for checkin by a couple hours and our Deluxe King Room wasn't ready so they upgraded us to a suite, so we were off to a very good start! The suite was superb, very spacious and very nice. Overall we thought the reception service was excellent, doormen were top drawer, location was great, and noise from adjacent rooms and street was nil. We did not eat at their restaurant, but were in the lounge for a few hours one evening with mediocre service. We agree with prior reviews that this hotel is not exactly "boutique", as it is more of a simple and efficient "medium to high end" hotel with a great location just a couple blocks from Union Square and on the Cable Car route. This was our second trip to San Fran and this hotel was much better than the one we stayed at before, in a similar location for about the same price.
reviews.title: Solid stay at Orchard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An average hotel, I can't see why it is rated no 3 in San Francisco. It does have good size rooms, good location & some of the doorman are friendly & helpful. But the decor is tired & the breakfast isn't worth it. Pay for room only & eat your breakfast somewhere else. Also found that you had to ask for coffee at breakfast, it was never offered. Some people describe this hotel as a Boutique hotel, it isn't. It's not modern enough & no thought has gone into the decor.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay here you will neither be impressed or annoyed, as I've already said it's just an average hotel and you can pay less for an average hotel.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

likes.disliked: — cost of parking in San Francisco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Searched for a hotel in our price range in the city and went with this recommendation from a friend. We were pleased with our stay in every respect. No troubles with reservation made through Expedia -- in fact, they confirmed; I did not need to. Staff were service oriented and friendly. Room was large, comfy, clean, great bathroom. Exceeded expectations. No noise and easy valet parking. A great stay!
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

likes.disliked: — It was a handicap room, which is not the best choice for a non-handicap person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was in San Francisco for work for 10 days and also keen to make the most of time in weekends for enjoying SF as it was my first visit. The hotel was perfect in every way. Great room and bathroom, absolutely quiet, and lovely eco products. Free wifi was a must for me for work and was totally reliable and speedy. I was seconds to the cable car, bus routes, and of course cabs. I could walk to ChinaTown, Union Square, Financial District and a fair radius in every direction around the hotel covering the main sites.
reviews.title: Couldn't have made a better choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: As a woman returning home sometimes late at night after dinners, I felt totally safe getting back to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful with shuttles, information, room service etc.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The two meals I had at the restaurant were excellent.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I will definitely return here, and in fact can't wait.
reviews.title: Super convenient, clean, an nicely appointed rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at The Orchard while attending a 2 day conference at the Presidio. The hotel is in a great location for seeing Chinatown and taking the famous SF Trolley to Fisherman Wharf or to Market Street. There are a lot of restaurants and convenience stores within an easy walk. The hotel room I was assigned was fresh and tidy and decorated in a serene manner. I have no complaints at all. The hotel is small but met all our needs. There is some street noise at night so if that is a problem bring your earplugs. I always carry mine but did not need to use them.
reviews.title: An oasis of luxurious calm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Orchard Hotel has two locations--one at the top of the hill on Bush street, the other at the bottom.
reviews.title: Orchard --a Tale of Two Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: There are distinct differences between the two properties.
reviews.title: Still the San Francisco Favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel at the bottom of the hill is new and has good amenities, such as a computer room and a gym.
reviews.title: recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel at the top of hill is older and has one computer at the front desk and a gym with broken equipment.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — Green hotel - friendly staff - clean - location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Further, the older property tends to be noiser, though the rooms tend to be larger.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco

likes.liked: — The beds and pillows were very comfortable; attenive staff.
likes.disliked: — Walking up and down hills; but that is all of San Franciso.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: My daughter and I just returned from a short, but wonderful first time visit to San Francisco. I booked our reservation at the Orchard Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I love to travel and have stayed at many wonderful hotels, and the Orchard is definitely one of my top five. The location is perfect for walking or riding the cable cars. My daughter and I felt totally safe and as a result, slept very well. Our room was cleaned immaculately, and all the employees we encountered were very helpful and nice. I don't normally watch movies while on vacation, but after a full day of sightseeing, shopping and walking the beautiful (but steep!) streets of S.F., it was nice to go back to the hotel, pick out a DVD and relax in our room for the evening. All the subtle touches add up to make the Orchard outstanding!
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel
Aboout the Orchard Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely, the staff great.....but... I notice that persons who stay at the Orchard Hotel are paying for parking. If you book this hotel through hotelres--- and get a "parking package" the parking is often included and the price is the same as if you did not do this. hotelres--- is a consolidator which many San Francisco hotels use, to make sure their hotel is as full as possible. It charges no fee, and does not charge your credit card, nor give you a noncancellable reservation. Once you make the reservation you deal with the hotel and its own cancellation policies. If you reserve online they send you a printable confirmation, otherwise they mail it to you. It really is a good resource. We stay in San Francisco several weekends/year and have favorite hotels. Once, when I tried to book ahead at one hotel, they told me they were full on that date and handed me a page of hotel listings and the hotelres--- site and advised that I try that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful; room was updated, very clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Clean, Close to everything, wonderful breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: Only problem was they had lost their liquor license, consequently there was only water, soft drinks in the room fridge.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved It!!!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel breakfast had everything we wanted: hard-boiled eggs, cold/hot cereals, yummy bisquits, bagels, toast, coffee, tea, fresh squeezed orange juice, ham/bacon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very good value at £50-£60 per person per night for twin room. Staff very helful. Very efficiently run, with great attention to detail. Centrally located close to Union Square. Would definitely go back. Probably the best hotel /best-value hotel we've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Orchard for a full week and did not have a single complaint. Staff members were friendly and helpful and the rooms were spotless. The location is excellent as the hotel is within walking distance of upscale stores like Macys and Tiffany’s in Union Square, as well as more reasonable ones like H&M, Ross and Forever 21. Additionally, it's conveniently close to all public transit. There's a Walgreen’s one block away, a steep hill block, but still a block. Another plus is the free dvds the hotels offers. The ravioli friti at the Italian restaurant on the corner across from the hotel are a must! I will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Two thumbs up as high as they can go
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: We stay in all kinds of places from the Elements in the Mission, a hostel, to the Laurel Inn, a boutique inn on Pacific Heights. We stayed here two nights in August while visiting family. We liked this hotel for the friendliness of the staff and big room. We rated it excellant because they were everything they said they would be at a competitive price.

reviews.title: Gorgeous and convenient! Recommended!
reviews.text: We agree with most of the positive reviews on this site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A word on the garbage trucks. If the noise is a worry, request a room high up in the front, because the dumpsters are loaded in the back alley. We were on the seventh floor in the back so we heard the trucks but not very loudly.
reviews.title: I left my heart (at the Orchard) in San Francisco!

likes.disliked: — Waiting for the (single) toaster at breakfast.

reviews.title: Convinience and service excellent!
reviews.text: Very good service. A nice room on the 10th floor with all the things you expect from a business class hotel. Large room, king sized bed, mini bar, iron, hair dryer, good sized bath.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: Breakfast is included. It's a cold buffet with a selection of baked goods, fresh fruit, plain yoghurt, cereal and even sliced cheese and ham. The only complaint was that it was exactly the same every day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
average
reviews.text: In house excercise facility was very small. You can go to a gym down the street for $15 / day if the streets of SF don't provide you will enough excercise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: Very convinient location. Good value. Excellent, helpful service.
reviews.title: Good value good location
Loved the Orchard Hotel
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a great location. You won't find a better hotel for the price - we got it for $179/night through The Orchard's website. The location is right off Powell, so the cable car stop is right at the corner. Chinatown and Union Square are each just a short walk away, and it's not far to Market Street where you can catch BART or a city bus to get around easily. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant, there are Aveda products in the bathroom, the rooms were comfortable and clean, and they have a large selection of DVDs available for loan. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. We would definitely stay there again, and since we had a great time in San Francisco we will definitely be back.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, will stay there again
reviews.text: We found the Orchard hotel on Orbitz and decided to go with it since most other things were booked due to a conference in town. We could not have been happier with our luck. The hotel is wonderfully located, about 30 feet from the cable car lines and a 10 minute walk from the Moscone Center, Chinatown and a BART station. Our greeting by the front desk staff was terffic. They did not have a room ready yet (we arrived at 10:30AM) but took our bags, made some suggestions for Dim Sum lunch, and did a good job orienting us. Upon our return, our room was ready and the staff quickly brought our bags up. The rooms are very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The linens are great and the bathroom was huge. Great comfy robes with linings and slippers were very much appreciated. It was also well lit, which is a complaint of mine. More and more hotels seem to leave you in the dark with 25 watt bulbs.

reviews.title: Great little hotel in San Francisco
reviews.text: Breakfast was a very nice continental buffet with fresh fruit, baked breads, hard boiled eggs, sliced meats and cheeses, juices and great coffee. It was at our first breakfast that we had the honor to meet the owner Mrs. S.C. Huang. She is extremely unassuming, warm, brilliant person who is often in the dining room having breakfast with the guests. She shared many stories about the hotel and it's sister hotel, The Orchard Garden. The hotels are built in the loving memory of her husband and her daughter, both of whom she recently lost to cancer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights before Christmas. We had a long flight from London and were both very jet-lagged so we were delighted with the friendly and efficient check in and the huge room with king size bed and every amenity to make our stay comfortable (luxurious bathrobes, French soap and body lotion, tea and coffee maker and CD/DVD player). Our room faced the back so it couldn't have been quieter. Breakfast each morning was a fabulous buffet and I was particularly happy with the fresh pineapple, watermelon and honeydew melon on offer. The staff were kind and helpful and the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf was right outside our door. We were also a 5 minute walk to Union Square. I would stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We did after reading the reviews & ditto all the positive comments. It was our first trip to San Francisco & we found all hotel staff extremely welcoming, helpful, very friendly & always eager to offer advice when asked. We didn't pre-book an airport shuttle but no problem, for $15.00 each we were at The Orchard within 1/2 hour. Our room, which was elegant & very clean, overlooked Bush St. but was very quiet. You can hear garbage trucks early in the morning, but the noise is short lived. The location can't be beat & we feel it was very good value after doing our homework on San Fran hotels. We had our best dinner during our 4 day stay in the hotel dining room (Vignette). Our young waiter even gave us a list of helpful hints re: public transit & popular "cheap eats". For that matter... we found San Francisco full of very warm friendly people. We bought a 3 day Muni Pass & used the cable cars & buses often. The cable car drivers were all very jovial & very patient & helpful with tourists. We booked Alcatraz ahead of time & were glad we did. San Francisco & The Orchard Hotel will not disappoint!
reviews.title: Great stay
